metadata.title: CVE-2022-2795 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
By flooding the target resolver with queries exploiting this flaw anattacker can significantly impair the resolver's performance, effectivelydenying legitimate clients access to the DNS resolution service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7').
